been contracted prior to the decree nisi being made absolute. Hence, it lacks the legal

Considering the Petitioner’s submissions in its  entirety, the Petitioner has failed and
suppressed the material  facts pertaining to the  valid appointment of  a nominee. This
Court  is  of  the  view  that  the  Petitioner  has  suppressed  the  facts  relating  to  a  legal
nomination pursuant to the Regulations. It is also pertinent to note that the Petitioner
has failed to disclose the existence of the Gazette containing the regulations pertaining
to the appointment of nominees. The Petitioner has failed to disclose to this Court the
disqualification  caused  as a result of the illegality getting married before the decree
nisi is made absolute.
